entry.title: documentScan: Merge duplicate zeroconf and lorgnette responses
entry.content:
Some scanners can be detected by both a lorgnette SANE backend and a

zeroconf response. When this happens, we want to prefer the connection

info from lorgnette because it has already been validated. However, we

want to take the display name and model info from the zeroconf record

because it matches the information shown in the printer settings page.



To consolidate the redundant records, copy the desired zeroconf fields

into the lorgnette response and then mark the zeroconf name as unusable.

This prevents further probing or other use of the zerconf record, but

includes the name in the final response from the lorgnette response.



Bug: b/322325211

entry.title: [Tabs] Change NTP discarding behavior
entry.content:
Change tab discarding behavior for Android to better handle tab groups

behind the AndroidTabGroupStableIds flag.



Added rules:

* NTPs that have one of the new TabGroupIds (indicating they are part of

a tab group) are saved to the tab list metadata file.

* NTPs that have root ID or tab group ID changed (indicating that they

were added or removed from a tab group) are forced to save a TabState

file so that the tab group information is not lost.



Bug: b/324230478

entry.title: Send extension CWS requests only if official API key is used
entry.content:
Currently, the CWSInfoService can send extension requests to the

CWS Item Service API endpoint with unconfigured/invalid API keys.

This can result in large number of rejected requests that are

retried unnecessarily. Only allow sending a request if official

Google API key is being used.



Also, remove CWSInfoService::CanFetchInfo as it is no longer

needed.

entry.title: desk_profiles: Adding DeskProfilesUsageStatus metric
entry.content:
This will let us track the relative adoption of desk profiles. Whenever

a desk bar is opened, we log a metric in one of three buckets:



1. Conditions for desk profiles are not met - this includes lacros

not being enabled, or there only being a single lacros user etc.

In general this means the user has not been presented with the

option to pick a profile.

2. Conditions to show the desk profile picker have been met, but the

user has not selected a profile for a desk.

3. The user has actively assigned a lacros profile to a desk.



It is primarily the relative sizes of buckets 2 and 3 that is of value.



BUG=b:315167975



Change-Id: Ic58a6213be0bf1ed2a008f456e83cbfb5ac5bf2b

entry.title: Improve permission prompting with app shim notification attribution.
entry.content:
When notifications are delegated to app shims for PWAs, the app

shim needs to get OS level notifications permission before

notifications can be delivered. To avoid double prompting in the

common case (where a "fresh" PWA requests notification permission)

this CL adds a new permissions::PermissionPrompt implementation

that forwards a notification permission request to the app shim,

treating the response to the OS level notification permission

prompt as also applying to chrome's prompt.



If the OS level prompt was previously granted already, the code

falls back to using the regular chrome permission prompt.

If the OS level prompt was previously denied already, the chrome

permission request is automatically denied.



All of this is still guarded by both the

AppShimNotificationAttribution and UseAdHocSigningForWebAppShims

features (the latter since this only works with the newer

UNUserNotificationCenter API).



Bug: 938661

Change-Id: If854a835878690564e30054185cf5273761b9798

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5100630

Reviewed-by: Robert Sesek

Commit-Queue: Marijn Kruisselbrink

entry.title: [views] Update constrained window to maximize overlap with screen
entry.content:
This CL partially reverts the changes in crrev.com/c/5274770 to

avoid repositioning the host window on the screen. There are platforms

for which their snapped bounds are reported to be outside the screen

and attempting to reposition the window will result in a recursive

Layout() loop.



The new behavior will prioritize repositioning the dialog completely

onto the nearest display. For platforms that clip children to their

parent widget's viewport the dialog is further adjusted to remain

within the host's bounds.



Bug: 41495267, 41495488

entry.title: [IP Protection] Initial support for disabling IP Protection at runtime
entry.content:
This CL implements disabling the IP Protection feature at runtime

based on the value of a user preference (that will eventually be

controlled by a user setting). This change is implemented behind

a disabled-by-default flag that will allow Chrome to continue to

experiment with enabling IP Protection before the user setting is

available.



What's implemented in this CL prevents new connections from being

tunneled via IP Protection and prevents new requests for tokens or

config information from being made to Phosphor, but doesn't tear

down existing proxied connections. This will be addressed in a

follow-up CL.



Bug: 41494110

entry.content:

was originally set up that way assuming that the player background

would come into view first and then the contents would fade in, but

now the composited view shows first so the entire mini player layout

but start transparent.

entry.title: Remove cancellation mechanism from //chrome/services/qrcode_generator
entry.content:
Before go/rusty-png-ui-gfx-decoder QR code generation had to spawn and

communicate with the utility process - this required support for

cancelling a pending request. With go/rusty-png-ui-gfs-decoder, the

generation happens in the same process - `qr_code_generator::Generate`

invokes the completion callback *synchronously*. This means that the

cancellation mechanism is a no-op and can be removed. (The completion

callback can also be replaced with just returning the result, but this

will be taken care of in a separate CL.)



Bug: 40263739

Change-Id: I45b92f104bfc337f106a779c4fa7534ea73acd2d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5278061

entry.title: media/gpu/ip_factory: Split CreateWithInputCandidates
entry.content:
The CL crrev.com/c/4807156 combined the ImageProcessorFactory Create()

function into the CreateWithInputCandidates() function. The new

CreateWithInputCandidates() function ran in two ways based on which

arguments were provided: like the previous Create() function with input

and output PortConfigs, or like the previous CreateWithInputCandidates()

function, where the PortConfigs were generated with hard-coded

VideoFrame::STORAGE_TYPE's and a FOURCC determined from the input

candidate list.



This commit is in a patch series that changes the decoder frame storage

type. The output storage type can no longer always be hard-coded to

STORAGE_TYPE_GPU_MEMORY_BUFFER. It needs to be set by the client.

However, adding arguments for storage type would be confusing since

PortConfig also contains the frame storage type.



This commit effectively reverts crrev.com/c/4807156. It splits

CreateWithInputCandidates() back into two functions. There are a few

changes that were left in. One is the FourCC::UNDEFINED enum. Another is

the removal of ImageProcessor::OutputMode from the factory function

arguments - it was always set to IMPORT. Another change is that the

arguments have been aligned to the ImageProcessorBackend order.



A follow-on CL will add the input and output VideoFrame::StorageType

arguments to CreateWithInputCandidates() to be used by

VideoDecoderPipeline.



Bug: b:277581596

BUG: b:294407804

Test: Encode, image processor, and decode tests pass on Cherry

Change-Id: I1e7becc818d28453940ccae4c0549c97fb5ede57

entry.title: Remove non-mainframe URL support in url lookup service
entry.content:
Previously RealTimeUrlLookupService checks subframe URLs if the

user has enabled enhanced protection. Chrome now has disabled checks

for all subresource URLs, so it is redundant to support subframe URLs

in RealTimeUrlLookupService.



`last_committed_url` and `is_mainframe` are specifically used to get

page load tokens for subframe URLs, so they are removed in this CL.



SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result.{IsMainframe}{UserCategory} doesn't

need the {IsMainframe} breakdown anymore, so it is replaced with

SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result.{UserCategory}.



SafeBrowsing.RT.RequestDestinations.Checked is removed because it is

no longer useful (all values are kDocument).



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=Remove unused histograms breakdown between mainframe and non-mainframe URLs



Bug: 324108312

entry.title: Shared Storage: More perf test refinements
entry.content:
Since these tests are always manually run, and the default is to use

10 pageset repeats, it can be difficult for the user to know which

pageset repeat is being run. We override the SharedPageState class in

order to be able to display the index of the current pageset repeat

(even if logging is set to non-verbose).



We also update the verbose logging of intra-story action iteration

number to be the actual index, instead of index + 1, so that both

displays are 0-indexed.



Finally, in the stories where `RENAVIGATE_AFTER_ACTION` is true, the

browser would fail to shut down gracefully and have to be killed. We

solve this by removing the unnecessary renavigation after the last

action iteration, as well as increasing the shutdown timeout.



Bug: 1516507,1218540

Change-Id: Iba50ba9d9ec63981083f3884c9518dad774893d4

entry.title: [DFM] Use llvm-objcopy --update-section
entry.content:
Previously, because older version of llvm-objcopy does not support

--update-section, we were using a combination of --remove-section and

--add-section to overwrite build-id. However, this --remove-section

also removes the segment assignment for the build-id section, and there

is no easy way to add segment assignment back to the ELF. The lost of

segment assignment makes crashpad unable to read the build-id from

memory. The note should be part of both a LOAD segment and a NOTE

segment. Being part of a LOAD segment causes it to be loaded into memory and being part of a NOTE segment allows things to find it and identify

it as a note at runtime.



Since the current version of llvm-objcopy supports --update-section,

this CL makes extract_partition.py use --update-section instead so that segment assignments are preserved after updating the build-id

section.



Bug: b/319920887

Change-Id: If6d3e4118827c20b11f182e3b6ded35724ade849

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5274020

entry.title: Reland: Enable sandbox shims to work regardless of timing
entry.content:
There are several limitations with the sandbox shims, root caused as

chromium sometimes accessing the Windows heap before it is safe to do

so, when OS code attempts to call NtCreateSection or NtMapViewOfSection

during super-early process start-up.



NtCreateSection - used to bypass CIG checks for binaries not signed by

Microsoft by brokering the syscall.



NtMapViewOfSection - used to listen to DLL loads in case we want to

also shim those DLLs.



This change adds early exits to the NtMapViewOfSection when these APIs

are called before kernel32 is loaded, to avoid needing to use the heap

while the process is in this super-early startup phase. There is not a

great publicly documented API we can use earlier, as Windows public API

is generally in kernel32, ntdll is mostly undocumented.



It should be safe to wait this long, as kernel32.dll should get loaded

before any other DLLs we try to shim at runtime.



For NtCreateSection shim, we modify it to only use stack memory instead

of heap memory. We did not apply the same approach as the

NtMapViewOfSection shim because NtCreateSection is not called for every

DLL load, so the approach to wait for kernel32 would mean the shims have

to depend on each other, though they are not always applied at the same

time.



Modified CheckWin10MsSignedPolicySuccess test so it actually applies the

shims used to load other DLLs on release build. Validated that this test

fails with AppVerifier enabled without these changes and passes with the

changes.



Verified manually with a smoke test that we can run chromium under

page heap, app verifier, and under the conditions from crbug.com/1519187



Also verified manually that sbox integration tests fail under these

conditions without the changes to the shims, and they pass with the

shim changes.



Previously attempted to land here, but reverted due to 1520945:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5214980



Validated that per the previous revert, the change works under

--enable-features=NetworkServiceCodeIntegrity,NetworkServiceSandbox



Attempted to land again here, and reverted due to dbg test failures:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241720



Additional usage of STACK_UNINITIALIZED added to avoid calls to

memcpy and memset before the CRT is initialized.



Also verified manually the tests pass on debug component build.



Bug: 1519187, 465515, 1004989, 1520945, 1081080

Change-Id: I4f4ac3c50212cff5fa3b119767c55f5aaa029f79

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5270572

Reviewed-by: Will Harris

Reviewed-by: Alex Gough

Commit-Queue: Stefan Smolen

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258064}

entry.title: Remove `FakeQRCodeGeneratorService` from `qr...bubble_unittest.cc`.
entry.content:
After go/rusty-qr-code-generator:



* QR generation happens in-process (i.e. unit tests don't need to do

anything special to avoid spawning a utility process)

* QR generation happens synchronously - a future CL will directly return

the generated QR code instead of using a semi-asynchronous callback



The latter point means that `FakeQRCodeGeneratorService` is exercising

behavior that doesn't really happen in the product code (because there

is no pause between requesting and getting the QR code). In other words,

there is no point in pausing product code execution in

`FakeQRCodeGeneratorService::WaitForRequest` + ability to pause will go

away after removing the asynchronous callback. Because of the above,

this CL removes `FakeQRCodeGeneratorService`.



This CL also opportunistically removes/fixes `DanglingUntriaged` by

making `raw_ptr` the last field of the class - this follows the guidance

to "make the unowned members appear last in the class" from

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/dangling_ptr_guide.md#incorrect-destruction-order



Bug: 40263739

Change-Id: I5895d790cccfbe6e1d7a7947fa398611f74294c8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273913

Reviewed-by: Peter Williamson

Commit-Queue: ukasz Anforowicz

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258057}

entry.title: VT: Handle document shutdown gracefully.
entry.content:
This patch does two things:

- After dom callback is finished, ensures that we have a view before

continuing. We skip the transition otherwise.

- When document is shutting down, skip any transition that is

outstanding. This is due to the fact that the execution context (dom

window) can notify of its destruction after document is destroyed.

However, the transition is owned by the document (via supplement), so

it can be destroyed before this notification and cause CHECKs

due to invalid state in the style tracker dtor.



R=khushalsagar@chromium.org



Fixed: 324109585

Change-Id: I64eaa886f89c89762cd3d5d8b5ad3b0fa4a1a4bf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273560

Reviewed-by: Khushal Sagar

Commit-Queue: Vladimir Levin

entry.title: sensors: Make virtual sensors always remember and report the latest reading
entry.content:
This concerns a discussion that started in https://crrev.com/c/5249795:

the idea is to make a virtual sensor leak fewer implementation details,

such as the fact that the current reading is lost when the sensor is

deactivated. This should not be observable from e.g. a web test, as

there is nothing mandating that this happen in the first place.



From an API user's perspective, once a reading is added to a virtual

sensor (including if this happens before a Sensor instance is created in

Chromium) it remains present until it is replaced by another one, even

if the sensor is stopped and reactivated. This is complemented by the

behavior added in https://crrev.com/c/5245506, in which any pending

reading (or, with this CL, the latest reading) is stashed until it can

be published.



In other words, a VirtualPlatformSensor now respects the following two

invariants:

1. Once a reading is set, it will remain set until it is replaced with

another reading.

2. Said reading will be added to the shared buffer and clients will be

notified whenever the sensor is activated.



While here, revert the part of https://crrev.com/c/5245506 that renamed

PlatformSensor::IsActiveForTesting() to is_active(), as this is no

longer needed.



Bug: 1520919, 1506995

Change-Id: I205432cbf196376f67a6bc1c84d69302ffe739ff

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5272509

Commit-Queue: Reilly Grant

Auto-Submit: Raphael Kubo Da Costa

Reviewed-by: Reilly Grant

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Read Aloud numbers / letters for ordered bulleted items.
entry.content:
Based on UX.



For an ordered list such as:

1. Run

2. Swim

3. Bike



Previously, only "Run, swim, bike" would be read aloud. With these

changes, the numbers are now read aloud so Read Aloud users can

easily hear that this text is part of an ordered list.



This won't impact unordered list items.

entry.title: Create AutofillPopupHideHelper
entry.content:
This CL moves part of the hiding logic of the

AutofillPopupControllerImpl to a new class, which will be used for

hiding both the autofill popup and the autofill IPH bubble(TBD).

The rest of the hiding logic will be moved in separate CLs.



Not all hiding events can be moved, as some of them are specific to

suggestion popups.



Moreover, there are some hiding events which don't even live in the

AutofillPopupControllerImpl, and cannot be easily moved. We will

decide what to do with them on a case-by-case basis.



The discussion about this has been laid out in the document linked

in the bug.

entry.title: [IntersectionOptimization] New invalidation strategy
entry.content:
The original invalidation method tried to catch under-invalidations

(and it did) but caused unacceptable performance regressions in

PrePaint.



Now I'm focusing on scroll performance for IntersectionOptimization.

- If anything changed affecting layout or transform, schedule full

intersection observation update.

- If only things changed affecting scroll or visibility (IOv2),

schedule kScrollOrVisibilityOnly update which will update

trackVisibility observers and observations whose

min-scroll-delta-to-update is exceeded by accumulated scroll delta

in the frame.

- Otherwise skip intersection optimization.



If we do an update, we'll ignore cached rects, to avoid

under-invalidation issues and the cost to invalidate.



Bug: 40883761

Change-Id: I84a57adc7d1f70fbfa5500a800a745b0e294b3ee

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273055

Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258019}

entry.title: [iOS][ffr] Support VoiceOver on swipe to incognito IPH
entry.content:
This CL enables VoiceOver users to see and hear the announcement for

swipe-to-incognito IPH. The user will see the reduced-motion version of

the IPH and hear the announcement at the same time; the view will be

dismissed as soon as the announcement stops, either because the user

initiates a swipe to the next accessibility element or that the screen

reader simply finishes the announcement.



Additionally, the initializer of GestureInProductHelpView is updated

to include an optional string for VoiceOver users only. This is

because the experience for VoiceOver users are different from others,

and may user different terminologies for the same type of action.

This is advised by the a11y team.



A new dismissal reason is also added to metrics, since it cannot be

determined whether the announcement has finished reading on dismissal,

or is interrupted by the user.



Bug: b:40276959

Change-Id: I9adf06a60551213688ccaa181ff9261bbd671074

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277700

Reviewed-by: Louis Romero

Auto-Submit: Ginny Huang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258018}

entry.title: [ios] Improve saving preferences in ApplicationContextImpl
entry.content:
Ensure that local state prefs and all ChromeBrowserStates' prefs are

saved when the application transition to foreground/background. This

happens before the application is terminated and thus should make it

more likely that the prefs are saved even if the watchdog kill the

app because the save takes too long.



Also, ensure that the transition to foreground/background save the

same set of preferences (previously local state was saved when the

app entered foreground while ChromeBrowserStates' prefs were saved

when the app entered background).



To this end, introduce `OnAppEnterState(...)` helper method to deal

with transition to either state, allowing to share any common code

while still correctly dealing with action that should only happen

when transitioning to either of foreground/background.



Bug: 41495439

entry.title: Add conversions from arrays of bytes to integers/floats
entry.content:
This is a common use case of memcpy(), and by providing a well-typed

API for this, we can catch mistakes at compile time, and ensure bounds

are checked at runtime if not.



These functions are all constexpr. To do that we need to provide our

own constexpr byteswap (until C++23), so that is done as well. We

forward calls to the base::SwapBytes over to the base::numerics

one.



This helps us avoid writing verbose use of spans and byte copies when

we're trying to go between bytes and primitives, such as:

uint32_t val;

base::byte_span_from_ref(val).copy_from(

base::as_byte_span(array).first());



Instead, we write:

uint32_t val = U64FromLeBytes(

base::as_byte_span(array).first());



Which is a compile-time bounds-checked, and always-initialized version

of what we used to write as:

uint32_t val;

// SAFETY: Hope that array is large enough, and that we don't change

// the type of u32_val one day.

memcpy(&val, array.data(), sizeof(uint32_t));



R=davidben@chromium.org



Bug: 1490484, 1519908

Change-Id: Iedb412c7b21fab79fbb49b4ae4acfc072dd75c7d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5245758

Reviewed-by: David Benjamin

Commit-Queue: danakj

> Exo: Pass trace ID across wayland to track frame submission.

entry.title: overview: Fix broken header of floated window in overview.
entry.content:
In tablet mode, when a floated window (i.e. not snapped yet) gets

added to splitview partial overview because another window was

snapped, the header of its overview item used to look corrupt.



This CL fixes the issue by avoiding setting any unclipped

size on the overview item of the floated window.



See bug for more details and videos.



Fixed: b/323136574

entry.title: Disable unknown pragma errors on cronet bots
entry.content:
The unsafe_buffer_usage pragma was added in Clang 17 and we use it to

prevent -Wunsafe-buffer-usage from firing when wrapped in

UNSAFE_BUFFERS(). Since cronet bots don't know about the pragma, the

pragma causes an error.



R=hans@chromium.org

entry.title: Save SessionIdGenerator seed to prefs on increment
entry.content:
The preferences are only saved to disk periodically, which can lead

to them not being saved if the app crashes soon after returning a

new id.



This can lead to duplicate id if the code that uses the new id save

it to another location with less delay and then the application crash

before the prefs has been saved. This has been observed on iOS in the

wild.



To limit the risk of this happening, store the value to prefs when

it is incremented, including when adding kCautionaryIdPadding. On

iOS, this solves the issue on iOS since on that system, the prefs

are saved unconditionally as part of the application startup after

calling SessionIdGenerator::Init().



Bug: 41495439

Change-Id: I2538c328dced802787928577c5ceccd48f2f35e5

entry.title: Revert "Reland "Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust""
entry.content:
This reverts commit c37505129ee027a86b3416141230a27516fba43b.



Reason for revert: suspect for crbug.com/324418102



Original change's description:

> Reland "Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust"

>

> This is a reland of commit e5f6f1434e631cd1c8154a41ee95ce6126688e9a.

> The only difference is: disabling a test that conflicts with

> the new implementation (see b/323984075).

>

> Original change's description:

> > Lacros testing: Make browser init param overriding more robust

> >

> > See chromium:1508245 for context.

> >

> > - Decide whether crosapi is enabled based on the command line

> > switches. In particular, make it independent of when/whether

> > BrowserTestBase::SetUp gets called.

> > We still provide DisableCrosapiForTesting for legacy reasons,

> > as some tests need to ovrerride it.

> >

> > - This, plus some new checks, make it hard for tests

> > * to accidentally and silently override the Ash-provided init

> > params with mostly empty ones, or

> > * to accidentally and silently prevent the Ash-provided params

> > from even being read.

> >

> > - Address a TODO in InProcessBrowserTest thanks to these changes.

> >

> > - Call DisableCrosapiForTesting in ViewsTestBase-derived tests that

> > run with crosapi enabled but are not prepared to set it up (and thus

> > would fail one of the new checks) and in fact don't need crosapi.

> >

> > - Remove InProcessBrowserTest::IsCrosapiEnabled() in favor of

> > !chromeos::BrowserParamsProxy::IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting(). There

> > is no need to have the InProcessBrowserTest predicate and it's not

> > an InProcessBrowserTest level concept.

> >

> > - Remove ScopedDisableCrosapiForTesting class, as there is no need for

> > a scope. Tests should either not call DisableCrosapiForTesting at

> > all or should do it very early on (CHECK'd). Undoing it is not

> > supported and it's not neceesary because tests run in separate

> > processes.

> >

> > - Add documentation to startup/README.md.

> >

> > - Remove some uses of IsCrosapiDisabledForTesting from production code

> > that are no longer needed.

> >

> > Bug: chromium:1508245

> > Change-Id: Id6b68a25dae4c50132f957f4b80879fdcde2e7b2

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5076190

entry.title: [Tab State] Fix NPE for null tab group ID in FlatBuffer
entry.content:
Any users that wrote flat buffer tab states prior to

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5258703 will

have a null tabGroupId field. I forgot to account for this when using

a struct rather than two longs for the token as longs have a default 0

value, but structs default to null.



This CL handles the NPE gracefully by only attempting to read the

struct if it is non-null and assuming the tabGroupId is zero/null/empty

otherwise and not setting it.



Fixed: b/324321591

entry.title: [ios] Change OrderController::DetermineNewActiveIndex() API
entry.content:
The API of OrderController::DetermineNewActiveIndex() was difficult

to use at it returned the new index of the active element after the

removal of the item was enacted however some of the clients updated

the WebStateList active_index() to the returned value immediately.



Currently, this worked in all situation because the value was used

incorrectly only when removing the tail of the list, so the index

was always before the first detached element, and thus valid.



Change the API of OrderController::DetermineNewActiveIndex() to

return the index of the new active index before closing the elements

scheduled for removal, and update client code that wants the index

after removal to use RemovingIndex::IndexAfterRemoval(...) on the

value.



Fix unit tests.



Bug: none

Change-Id: Ic9cba28db06be8541ea1cdcc828d0a7445b42ba0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5259239

Reviewed-by: Asami Doi

Commit-Queue: Sylvain Defresne
